metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11713 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur in HTTP/2 when a cached HTTP/2 stream is closed while still in use, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11713` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
